Package it.polimi.ingswPSP35.server.controller.divinities

Class AbstractTurn

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingswPSP35.server.controller.divinities.AbstractTurn
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultTurn
public abstract class AbstractTurn
extends java.lang.Object
This class is responsible for the sequence in which actions can be performed by a given Divinity. This is accomplished by using two lists to create a behaviour similar to a finite state machine.

The initial state is set by the reset method, transitions between states can only be triggered by the tryAction method, and are regulated by checking the elements of the list ActionsTaken.

Note that implementations of this class are either private inner classes of the corresponding Divinity, or DefaultTurn

Author:
Paolo Galli
See Also:
DefaultTurn

    • AbstractTurn

      protected AbstractTurn​(java.util.List<Action> availableActions, java.util.List<Action> actionsTaken)
      Constructor with set state

      availableActions - List of actions that can be performed in the current state
      actionsTaken - List of actions that have already been performed

  • Method Details

    • copy

      public abstract AbstractTurn copy()
      Returns a new instance of this AbstractTurn in its current state. Note that calling tryAction on the new instance might alter the state of the game if the corresponding Divinity is not handled properly.

      Used by TurnTick to call DefeatChecker.

      Returns:
      a new instance of this AbstractTurn in its current state

    • tryAction

      public abstract boolean tryAction​(Coordinates workerCoordinates, Action action, Coordinates squareCoordinates)
      Attempts to perform an action by calling methods of this AbstractTurn's corresponding Divinity.

      If the action is successful, the state is updated and the methods returns true.

      Parameters:
      workerCoordinates - Coordinates of the Worker attempting the Action
      action - Action to be attempted
      squareCoordinates - Coordinates of the square to attempt the action on
      Returns:
      true if the action is successful

    • getActionsTaken

      public java.util.List<Action> getActionsTaken()
      Getter for actionsTaken parameter. Used by DefeatChecker.
      Returns:
      actionsTaken parameter

    • getAvailableActions

      public java.util.List<Action> getAvailableActions()
      Getter for availableActions parameter. Used by DefeatChecker.
      Returns:
      availableActions parameter

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Method called to reset the class to the initial state.

      This method is only called by the constructor and after this turn has concluded normally.
